title: Katie Price 'signs up to Celebrity SAS: Who Dares Wins in a bid to get fit'
text:
Katie Price is said to have signed up for Celebrity SAS: Who Dares Wins in a bid to get fit.

In a clip posted to her YouTube account, the former glamour model, 41, teased she's training for a 'top secret project', amid claims she could possibly be made bankrupt within six weeks after allegedly failing to keep up with her monthly payments.

The TV personality - who participated in the 2009 London Marathon - is reportedly 'determined to be ready' for the tense challenge, which sees contestants battle for survival in an ex-military base in the Chilean Andes.

Working hard: Katie Price is said to have signed up for Celebrity SAS: Who Dares Wins in a bid to get fit

A source told The Sun: 'Kate has been teasing fans about a secret project she's been training for. She's not supposed to tell anyone but as ever Pricey finds it hard to keep her mouth shut.

'She's signed up to do the next series of Celebrity SAS on Channel 4 and she's desperately trying to get fit for it. Katie might be a reality telly veteran - but there's no tougher show on TV.

'Almost everyone broke down in tears at one point. So Katie is determined to be ready and has been having workout sessions with her trainer Jack, who helped her get fit for her marathon attempts.'

The likes of presenter AJ Odudu, actor Jeremy Irvine and winner Wayne Bridge starred in the first celebrity edition on Channel 4 earlier this year.

Money issues: The former glamour model, 41, has teased she's training for a 'top secret project', amid claims she could be made bankrupt within six weeks (pictured last month)

Challenge: The TV personality - who participated in the 2009 London Marathon (pictured with ex-husband Peter Andre at the race) - is reportedly 'determined' for the tense task

Sharing her thoughts on her upcoming project, Katie struggled to catch her breath on the treadmill as she said in the clip: 'I've got five weeks to go until this particular thing I'm training for. Even reading the test makes me feel sick.'

MailOnline has contacted Katie's representatives for further comment.

Meanwhile, the reality star is being pursued by creditors and the taxman after revealing she has burned through her entire £45million fortune.

The I'm A Celeb personality submitted a payment plan - known as an Individual Voluntary Agreement - over her estimated £250,000 debts to the High Court last December.

Poor stamina: Katie - who will reportedly leave the UK on Thursday for the show - struggled to catch her breath on the treadmill with her trainer Jack in a recent clip

Candid: 'I've got five weeks to go until this particular thing I'm training for. Even reading the test makes me feel sick', she admitted

Intense: The likes of presenter AJ Odudu, actor Jeremy Irvine and winner Wayne Bridge(pictured) starred in the first celebrity edition on Channel 4 earlier this year

Had she not done so the court could have declared her bankrupt and appointed a trustee to sell off her assets, including her £2million home in Dial Post, West Sussex.

Katie was not at the hearing at the Insolvency and Companies Court at the High Court on Monday, but judge Sally Barber noted that the TV star had allegedly failed to keep up with her monthly repayments with her IVA.

She added: 'Technically it's not an adjournment so I'm extending time. Service will be effective on the expiry of seven days of completion of such sending of the email and such posting.

'Once you've done both, service will be effective on the expiry of seven days. I also extend the time for hearing the bankruptcy petition - I think six weeks.'

The hearing was adjourned until November 27 to hear whether or not she will be made bankrupt. A draft petition notice will be served to her in the post.

Katie bought her sprawling, nine-bedroom house in 2014, and includes the 1930s house - which comes with 12.25 acres, a swimming pool, tennis courts, stables and paddocks.
description: In a clip posted to her YouTube account, the TV star, 41, teased she's training for a 'top secret project', amid claims she could be made bankrupt within six weeks.
